doj-ep-01.summary: Abdul Rahman Murphy opens this powerful series by describing the moment the trumpet (As-Sur) is blown by the angel Israfil. This cataclysmic event marks the end of life as we know it. The lecture covers the two blows of the trumpet - the first causing all creation to perish, and the second bringing everyone back to life for judgment.

hadiths.text: The Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: 'How can I be at ease when the one with the horn has put it to his lips and tilted his forehead, listening and waiting to be commanded to blow it?'
hadiths.context: Used to establish the urgency and reality of the Day of Judgement - the angel is ready at this very moment.

verses.arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَصَعِقَ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَاءَ اللَّهُ
verses.translation: And the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills.
verses.context: The central verse describing the first blowing of the trumpet and its devastating effect on all creation.

keyQuotes.text: The angel Israfil has not blinked since the day he was created. He is waiting. The question is: are we?
Knowing the Day of Judgement is real should not paralyze you with fear - it should mobilize you with purpose.

actionItems.text: Before sleeping tonight, ask yourself: if the trumpet were blown now, am I ready?
Set a daily reminder to recite the dua for protection from the trials of the grave
Share the concept of accountability with someone who may benefit from it
Read Surah Az-Zumar (39:68-75) with tafsir to understand the sequence of events

nextSteps: Watch Episode 2 to learn what happens after all of mankind is resurrected
Reflect on how awareness of the Day of Judgement changes your daily priorities
